```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
I <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # current (A)
R <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # resistance (ohms)

ans <- signif(I * R, 2)
dis <- c(I / R)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, range = c(0, 2)*ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 5)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{V}$", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
What voltage is applied across a $`r R` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$ resistor if the current is
$`r I` \,\mathsf{A}$?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use Ohm's law:

$$V = IR = (`r I` \,\mathsf{A})(`r R` \,\mathsf{\Omega}) = `r ans` \,\mathsf{V}$$
